column4: surely everything i need to get on the internet should be included in the OS install bit
well, i just bought a mew laptop with vista on, installed ubuntu inside vista and when i boot into ubuntu, my net connection doesnt come up for me to connect to
i just want to be on ubuntu again
in ubuntu? on the inernet? where?
so i type in the terminal....
and then when i see the files that are supposed to be on there.... i do what with them?
simply go to packages.ubuntu.com. there you can download any package
those are NOT the pages you are looking for or the pages I and Dr_willis told you about. go to the proper ones
then find out more before you install drivers you don't even know if they work
if it "Just worked" it doesn't use ndiswrapper
answer my question: what wlan chip
